feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: Through VF04 system will not allow to create multiple deliveries with single invoice
entry.content:
Hi Team,

When i am trying to create the single billing documents with multiple deliveries through VF04 and collective billing docuemnt option i am not able to create the single invoice.

Kindly please check and help on this.

I have give you the test cases in Q10 system for multiple deliveries.

72975754

72975755

72975756

72975757

Even i have checked payer and incoterms also for all deliveries we are having single sales order with same material.

In VTFL Maintain Data VBRK/VBRP as 604.

 

Thank you.

entry.title: How to remove a Billing Plan line item from Sales Order?
entry.content:
Dears,
How can I remove a Billing Plan line item (added e.g. by mistake)? There is no button for that, and the item is also not removed after deleting the Date description and Billing type, see the attached screenshot.

Any ideas? 

P.S. Such line items are shown in the custom report where all the Billing Plan line items should be displayed (incl. blocked ones) but not the one I mentioned - that one will not be used/billed and should be removed.  
System version: SAP ECC 6.0 Enh Pack 5

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: FIORI Sales order creation Version vs. GUI VA01
entry.content:
Hello SCN,

unfortunately, I was not able to find the corresponding clue on this.

Why is the behavior in Sales Order Management – Version 2, or when navigating to "Create Sales Order" [not the VA01- GUI], so different?

When I start via F3893 → "New Sales Order," I noticed the following differences:

  • No pop-up for material substitution

  • No pop-up for “partial confirmation” or availability check

Did I click something wrong, or is this really the case?

Is there a list of the differences?

Thanks!

entry.title: How Other VAT Reg. No. is determined in Billing?
entry.content:
We have a few other VAT registration numbers defined for a customer in the 'Control data' tab -> 'Other' button. The main VAT number is DE... (KNA1-STCEG), and the others are NL... and FR... (KNAS-STCEG), see the attached screenshot. There are no different addresses for the NL and FR registrations, confirmed with FI.

How can these additional VAT numbers be determined in the standard sales process (and finally in Billing, VBRK-STCEG)? Especially since we don’t need extra addresses or redundant master data for Ship-to - that’s why VAT numbers for registration in other countries are defined as 'Others'. Is there an option to select a different destination country or a specific VAT number in the sales document for such cases? 

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: Skipping popup messages in VA03 for Sales Order Incompletion Logs
entry.content:
When I open any Sales Order in VA03 then popup messages related to Sales Order incompletion log are coming. For few Sales Orders, the incompletion logs are in large number and user has to click many times to close those popup messages. 

I have analysed and found a SAP NOTE 1459252 which is suggesting to create a custom program to delete the table entries from VBUV table which are having Sales Order overall status(VBAK-GBSTK) as completed (‘C’) or initial(' '). But, I want to confirm that, is deleting the records from SAP standard table i.e. VBUV table safe? 

Is there any other alternative to achieve the requirement i.e. to open a Sales Order by skipping the popup messages for Incompletion logs?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been archived - FOR Specific Material
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Our system does not create the sales order when the user enters a specific material and presses the save button. The system gives a success message saying "Standard order 212345 has been saved". But when we look at the sales order in VA03,  the system error says "SD document 212345 is not in the database or has been archived". 

Please note that this issue happens only when we enter the specific material item, not the other material.

I have compared the material master with other good materials. It doesn't have issues. 

Can you please advise if anyone has come across this issue?

Thanks in Advance,

Regards,

Rajpal

entry.title: Business partner 2288 already existsMessage no. R1286
entry.content:
Hello community

Business Scenario
During the ECC to SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 conversion project, we are executing the Customer-Vendor Integration (CVI) activities.

Both Customers and Vendors have been historically maintained with the same external number range (ZZ: 0000000001 – 0000009999).
The same external number range has also been defined for Business Partners (ZZ: 0000000001 – 0000009999) 

In the direction BP ↔ Customer/Vendor, the mapping was configured so that identical numbers should be used across BP, Customer, and Vendor.

Current Issue
The CVI Cockpit (CVI_COCKPIT) was executed successfully for Vendors.

For Vendor 2288, a Business Partner 2288 was created and linked (entry exists in table CVI_VEND_LINK).

However, when attempting to synchronize Customers with the same number (2288), the system raises the following errors:

Business partner 2288 already exists

Message no. R1286

When trying to extend the existing BP manually in transaction BP with the Customer role (FLCU00), the system does not allow saving because the Customer key already exists in KNA1/KNB1.

The following error is issued:
Customer data was not saved due to error CVI_MAPPING 042; see long text

Message no. CVI_BDT_ADAPTER050

Problem Statement


Due to the identical number ranges, when trying to synchronize Customers, the system fails because the BP number already exists and is linked to the Vendor.

Manual maintenance in BP is also blocked, as the Customer number already exists in KNA1/KNB1.

How can we solve this problem?

 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Automatic Batch/Serial No Determination in vl01n
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

 

We are automating batch and serial number determination during outbound delivery.

  • Batch should be determined automatically.

  • Serial numbers (received from a third-party system and stored in a custom table) should be assigned automatically when navigating to Extras → Serial Numbers.

For batch determination, I found the exit USEREXIT_BATCH_DETERMINATION.
Could you please suggest which exit or BAdI can be used for automatic serial number assignment?

Is there any Other ways to approach this requirement?

entry.title: Can Flexible Workflow Handle Multi-Level CMR Approvals by Amount as standard functionality?
entry.content:
We need to implement a multi-level approval process for Credit Memo Requests (CMR) based on the request amount. For example:

  • CMR below €1,000 requires approval from Level 1 and Level 2.

  • CMR between €1,000 and €2,000 requires approval from Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3.

Since SAP standard does not allow the request creator to be an approver, can we configure this hierarchy using standard Flexible Workflow functionality, or would customization be necessary? 

If customization is necessary, can someone please summarize - what needs to be done?

entry.title: In VA01, I do not want the Req Delivery Date to update to the item's first date
entry.content:
Good day,

When I create a Sales Order,  and I immediately change the Req Delivery Date (field: RV45A-KETDAT) to also update the first date of the line items (field:  RV45A-ETDAT).

The Req Delivery Date normally defaults to Today's date, but I want to prevent that the first dates on the item level do not get updated when the user creates the Sales Order and updates the Req Delivery Date immediately. This is to ensure that the materials entered, do not get seen as a future requirement and should be picked up immediately by MRP.  Otherwise I have to configure another MRP type to ignore the delivery lead time.

Any suggestions how I can do this?

The Req Delivery Date we want to use as the Delivery Date we will communicate to the customer as to when their goods will be delivered to them. However the items's first date should be today's date as MRP should immediately be triggered for replenishment.

entry.title: Dynamic error message is getting repeated in ME21N
entry.content:
Hello Team,

In me21n I need to display error message for wrong GL account entered in ASSIGNMENET CATEGORY TAB .I am passing error message in BADI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST .Every time if I am giving wrong GL account it is getting added in pop up .So pop up has older error related to  GL account .I need to show only last error message for GL account which I have entered.How to achieve this.

entry.title: IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS Date type : Dates are not converted into the date type defined in customazing
entry.content:
FM :IDOC_INPUT_ORDERS  & Date type :

Dates from segment E1EDK03 idoc type ORDERS  are not converted into the date type defined in SPRO  "Define item proposal types" (V_TVAK-KPRGBZ).

 

Then error occurs during treatment cause the date format are in days and not in the default date type defined in customazing.

entry.title: Migration to SAP S/4HANA: What happens to VKM5?
entry.content:
Dear all,

We are currently on SAP ECC EHP8, and as we plan the migration to SAP S/4HANA, I would like to know if transaction VKM5 will become obsolete. We are planning some developments that will impact this transaction, so I would appreciate if someone could clarify whether it will still be available in S/4HANA, or if it will eventually become obsolete over time.

entry.title: Additional Charges in Sales Invoice
entry.content:
Hello experts,

My client needs to record a delivery charges in Sales invoice without hitting the Revenue G/L account. Their scenario is that they collect Delivery charges from the Customer and deliver the Goods by themself and record that charges in the Sales invoice additionally. How can  we do this ?

entry.title: Issue with Acct. Document status/clearance after cancellation of cancelled Billing Document
entry.content:
Hi, I'm dealing with a somewhat unusual situation where we're stuck with an accounting document (status "Not cleared") related to a cancelled Billing document. The cancellation document was canceled as well, both cancellations without Accounting document (not released to accounting) - this probably caused the issue. See the screenshot of document flow attached.

In short, that "Not cleared" accounting document is no longer needed, but we cannot cancel or reverse it - in SD, VF11 is not possible in this flow anymore, and in FB08 (FI) there is an error message: "Not possible to reverse the document in financial accounting."

Do you have any suggestions on how to cancel or reverse that unwanted, not cleared accounting document in this case?

Regards
Krzysztof

entry.title: My sales order VA01 transaction timed out
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

My VA01 transaction timed out after pressing the SAVE button.

The ST22 log showed that the program MV45AFZA was triggered and the corresponding subroutine
USEREXIT_REFRESH_DOCUMENT caused it.

Below is the code snippet of the endless loop.

DO.
SELECT SINGLE * FROM vbak
WHERE vbeln = d_bapiso.
IF sy-subrc = 0.
clear vbak.
EXIT.
ENDIF.
ENDDO.

What is your proposed solution and what do you think is the rootcause?

Thanks,

New cloud guy

entry.title: Impact of Sales Order Delivery Date Change on Released Production Orders in S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Question:
I am working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud.

Scenario:

I have a sales order with a confirmed delivery date.

A production order has already been created, released, and production has started.

I also run the PP/DS optimizer as a nightly background job.

My question:
If I change the delivery date of the sales order, what will be the effect on the already released and started production order?

Will the system automatically reschedule the released production order?

How will this be handled in the nightly optimizer run?

Will I only see alerts/exception messages, or will there be any automatic changes to the order?

I would like to understand the expected system behavior and whether manual planner intervention is required in such cases.

entry.title: Rebates
entry.content:
Hi All,
The issue relates to rebates. Rebate no. 31286 has not current accrual. To make accrual current Accounting Team uses VBOF tcode. Unfortunately, when Agnieszka entered rebate 31286 into VBOF transaction, she received notification:

Due to this notification, we cannot make accrual current. All above invoices have been issued before June 2024 and have this same billing type ZCI. Invoices from #921345566 to #921347271 have old provision account 214216. The rest have new provision account 114128. All invoices are visible in rebate agreement (in Drill-down Menu). I have checked Change report for all listed invoices. SAP does not report any changes for them.

The other ZCI invoices, issued after June 2024, are not blocking the VBOF.

Could you please support us in this case? 

Nothing changed. We still do not see accruals

 

The issue is with Z209 condition type only, but it is affected differently.

For example, the invoice 921103655 as an example to explain the issue with billing date 02.05.2024

Billing document 921103655 was created with pricing procedure ZCRAE.

It has net value 885.06 EUR = Z003 condition value 894.00 EUR +  Z209 condition value 8.94- EUR.

The issue is in Pricing Procedure ZCRAE ( Configuration ) the condition type Z209 somehow removed in the configuration.

May be because the invoices which are showing in the VBOF are created when Z209 exist in the configuration. Because it is removed from configuration, VBOF is showing the 4 invoices which are not updated.

 Below screenshots are from WPR and another system having old data.

 WPR system missing Z209 in configuration.

Another system ( SDR ) having old configuration 

Now the Solution will be complex to solve, whether needs to cancel the invoices and recreate ( 2024 invoices is not possible ) or need to revert the configuration with Z209 condition type and run the VBOF again. 

 Please suggest how should we proceed.

entry.title: IN SAP ,Number of Packages 15 and Shell Roll Line Item Delivery Quantity 16 are not same.
Opportunité à pourvoir - Proposition d'un CDI chez un client final
entry.content:
Bonjour à tous,
Je recherche un technico fonctionnel SAP SD pour un CDI chez un client final basé à la Défense - MM serait un plus - Anglais impératif - un profil technique en lien avec les différentes entités du groupe dans le monde. Déplacements occasionnels envisageables.  Pour plus d'informations me contacter et m'adresser votre email pour recevoir la fiche de poste. Au plaisir de faire votre connaissance. Brigitte - bchemel@capest-conseils.com

Je vais rechercher également des profils EWM et SCM. Faites vous connaitre
